availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Micah T. Chrisman (Boyle County, Kentucky, attorney and clerk of circuit court)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, attorney and court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Chrisman. Father of James Chrisman and John T. Chrisman. Clerk of court in Boyle County in 1860. Clerk of the Boyle County Court from 1861 to 1862. Attorney in Boyle County in 1863. Clerk of the Boyle Circuit Court in 1864. Clerk of the Boyle Circuit Court in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 893.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861,” in 1862 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1862), 305.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865,” in 1865/66 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 11.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 05, Boyle County, Kentucky, 1863, p. 135 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Micah T Chrisman (1817-1875)," Memorial #57832411, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/57832411 (accessed June 17, 2020).
KYR-0001-004-0397.
